Class SortControl

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Dialog
                  javax.swing.JDialog
                      jam.SortControl
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, Controller, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public final class SortControl
extends javax.swing.JDialog
implements Controller

Class to control the offline sort process Allows you to enter the list of files to sort an the output pre-sorted file if you have one

Version:
1.0
Author:
Dale Visser and Ken Swartz
See Also:
Serialized Form

beginSort

public void beginSort()
Start sorting offline.

atSortStart

public void atSortStart()
Called at the start of a new sort thread by the sort thread. All it does is suspend the SortDaemon thread, to make the offline sorting loop wait at its beginning for the thread to be resumed when the user requests the sort to begin.

Specified by:
atSortStart in interface Controller

isSortNext

public boolean isSortNext()
Called by sorter after startup looking to see if there is a next file to sort. If there is a next file, we tell StorageDaemon to open it, and return true.

Specified by:
isSortNext in interface Controller
Returns:
true if there is a next event file to sort

atSortEnd

public void atSortEnd()
Called back by sorter when sort encounters a end-run-marker. Tell StorageDaemon to close file. Tells user sorting is done and unlocks fields so that new files can be input to sort.

Specified by:
atSortEnd in interface Controller

atWriteEnd

public void atWriteEnd()
Method not implement for SortControl, called by sorting when at end of writing file. implemented in RunControl

Specified by:
atWriteEnd in interface Controller
